intro: Eufragia viscosa, commonly known as the sticky eufragia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems that produce a sticky substance, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Eufragia viscosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
